intro: Kanimia thapsoides, commonly known as the white thapsia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent, while its roots are often used in traditional medicine. Kanimia thapsoides is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
